verses.verse: (Elihu Proclaims God’s Justice) Elihu further answered and said:
“Hear my words, you wise men; Give ear to me, you who have knowledge.
(Job 6:30; 12:11) For the ear tests words As the palate tastes food.
Let us choose justice for ourselves; Let us know among ourselves what is good.
“For Job has said, (Job 13:18; 33:9) ‘I am righteous, But (Job 27:2) God has taken away my justice;
(Job 6:4; 9:17) Should I lie concerning my right? My wound is incurable, though I am without transgression.’
What man is like Job, (Job 15:16) Who drinks scorn like water,
Who goes in company with the workers of iniquity, And walks with wicked men?
For (Mal. 3:14) he has said, ‘It profits a man nothing That he should delight in God.’

“Therefore listen to me, you men of understanding: ((Gen. 18:25; Deut. 32:4; 2 Chr. 19:7); Job 8:3; 36:23; Ps. 92:15; Rom. 9:14) Far be it from God to do wickedness, And from the Almighty to commit iniquity.

(Job 34:25; Ps. 62:12; (Prov. 24:12; Jer. 32:19); Ezek. 33:20; (Matt. 16:27); Rom. 2:6; (2 Cor. 5:10; Rev. 22:12)) For He repays man according to his work, And makes man to find a reward according to his way.
Surely God will never do wickedly, Nor will the Almighty (Job 8:3) pervert justice.
Who gave Him charge over the earth? Or who appointed Him over the whole world?
If He should set His heart on it, If He should (Job 12:10; Ps. 104:29; (Eccl. 12:7)) gather to Himself His Spirit and His breath,
((Gen. 3:19); Job 10:9; (Eccl. 12:7)) All flesh would perish together, And man would return to dust.
“If you have understanding, hear this; Listen to the sound of my words:
(2 Sam. 23:3; Job 34:30) Should one who hates justice govern? Will you (Job 40:8) condemn Him who is most just?
(Ex. 22:28) Is it fitting to say to a king, ‘You are worthless,’ And to nobles, ‘You are wicked’?
Yet He ((Deut. 10:17; Acts 10:34; Rom. 2:11, 12)) is not partial to princes, Nor does He regard the rich more than the poor; For (Job 31:15) they are all the work of His hands.
In a moment they die, (Ex. 12:29; Job 34:25; 36:20) in the middle of the night; The people are shaken and pass away; The mighty are taken away without a hand.
“For ((2 Chr. 16:9); Job 31:4; Ps. 34:15; (Prov. 5:21; 15:3; Jer. 16:17; 32:19)) His eyes are on the ways of man, And He sees all his steps.
((Ps. 139:11, 12; Amos 9:2, 3)) There is no darkness nor shadow of death Where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
For He need not further consider a man, That he should go before God in judgment.
(Job 12:19; (Dan. 2:21)) He breaks in pieces mighty men without inquiry, And sets others in their place.
Therefore He knows their works; He overthrows them in the night, And they are crushed.
He strikes them as wicked men In the open sight of others,
Because they (1 Sam. 15:11) turned back from Him, And (Ps. 28:5; Is. 5:12) would not consider any of His ways,
So that they (Job 35:9; James 5:4) caused the cry of the poor to come to Him; For He ((Ex. 22:23); Job 22:27) hears the cry of the afflicted.
When He gives quietness, who then can make trouble? And when He hides His face, who then can see Him, Whether it is against a nation or a man alone?—
That the hypocrite should not reign, Lest the people be ensnared.
“For has anyone said to God, ‘I have borne chastening; I will offend no more;
Teach me what I do not see; If I have done iniquity, I will do no more’?
Should He repay it according to your terms, Just because you disavow it? You must choose, and not I; Therefore speak what you know.
“Men of understanding say to me, Wise men who listen to me:
‘Job (Job 35:16; 38:2) speaks without knowledge, His words are without wisdom.’
Oh, that Job were tried to the utmost, Because his answers are like those of wicked men!
For he adds (Job 7:11; 10:1) rebellion to his sin; He claps his hands among us, And multiplies his words against God.”
